title: Solution to the "kiss" issue.
body:
Given that there seems (from my cursory looking today) to be a large contingent of players on the EUW/EUNE servers whose primary language is Dutch, why does Riot not just hire (or find current) a few (1-2) support agents in Dutch, and work on translating the client and voice lines into Dutch?

While this obviously isn't a scientific poll and won't be completely accurate, please select below. I'm trying to gauge how many players actually speak dutch (or *would* if it was a supported language).

Keep in mind that it being a supported language would remove this "kiss" issue entirely, as a chat log in Dutch would be judged as if it was Dutch.

replies.body: Hiring additional people for support and then also hiring enough people for enough time to translate the client and voice lines into Dutch would be a comically vast effort when all they need to do is train support agents to have enough sense to say "oh, that means 'kiss' in Danish, TIL, cool, I've unbanned you, have a great day" rather than "no matter what language you pretend to speak, English is the language you're actually thinking of, and you said something that's bad in English, so you obviously told someone to kill themselves, so the ban stands."

The problem is that you cannot train people to speak a language without training them to speak a language.

You are advocating that "k.y.s." no longer be punished because anyone can just claim "I was speaking Dutch".

> [{quoted}](name=rujitra,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=JnaQRPEH,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2019-08-27T22:08:28.609+0000)
>
> The problem is that you cannot train people to speak a language without training them to speak a language.
> 
> You are advocating that "k.y.s." no longer be punished because anyone can just claim "I was speaking Dutch".

All they have to do is take two seconds to Google something and be capable of learning.

I don't think "the Dutch defense" will become common. Even if it does, determining when it's a lie seems like a reasonable expectation for a support rep. One technique that support reps could use would be to look at the rest of the sentence if available, or check out the rest of the chat log. If there's a bunch of Dutch in there, the questionable word might be Dutch. If there's no Dutch to be found, the player might be trying to lie their way out of a ban.

That's not a valid way to issue or remove punishments at all.

Language is nuanced. It takes a lot more than "google" to be able to understand and determine grammar, intent, whether the usage of that word is appropriate in the context, etc.

The word being dutch does not mean it is appropriate. I can say "taco pineapple banana sex" and the use of the word "sex" may be English, but that doesn't mean the sentence makes sense.

> [{quoted}](name=rujitra,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=JnaQRPEH,comment-id=0003000000010000,timestamp=2019-08-27T22:32:46.382+0000)
>
> That's not a valid way to issue or remove punishments at all.
> 
> Language is nuanced. It takes a lot more than "google" to be able to understand and determine grammar, intent, whether the usage of that word is appropriate in the context, etc.
> 
> The word being dutch does not mean it is appropriate. I can say "taco pineapple banana sex" and the use of the word "sex" may be English, but that doesn't mean the sentence makes sense.

Doing some simple research and using one's head is perfectly valid. As you said above, this case is easy. There's no need to make it hard.

"Sorry boss, I can't come into work today."
"Why not?"
"It's raining."
"What? It's sunny out."
"Well, it could rain. Might even flood! I need a boat."
"Â¯\\(Â°\_o)/Â¯"

It will happen
look  you know the french word for "shower" ?
douche

And that's only 1 example, instead of trying to solve these thing individually , we should have a system prepared to face them.

A Rioter fluent in dutch actually looked at it and still decided that he meant it maliciously.

Edit: mb, it was orange, not a red. Not sure what orange means.
This is news to me - do you have a link to this so I can add it to the OP here?

Ugh im bad at forums. Its one of the posts recently. He linked the original post and you can go through the thread. A rioter with title of mechanic or wrencher or some shit responded in it a few times.
Ah, if it's the wrenchmen, I'm pretty sure those are just the equivalent of "specialist" on the NA boards. But I'm not sure.

> [{quoted}](name=rujitra,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=JnaQRPEH,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2019-08-27T22:18:32.223+0000)

Is that it? Sorry i was being lazy, I think i figured it out. And mb, i think it might be a forum mod or something. I figured it was Red cuz I've never seen orange before.
Pretty sure It wasnâ€™t a rioter, it was a mod.

> [{quoted}](name=BladeSteel,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=JnaQRPEH,comment-id=0004000200000000,timestamp=2019-08-28T00:00:39.776+0000)
>
> Looked orange to me.

Okay yeah that is orange now that i see it again. Idk what orange means lol. Forum mod? Yeah youre probably right. When you said mod I thought blue or purple. Too many colors!
Reminds me of a post i saw once where they made a rainbow from the colors (and they did it besides indigo) so we have red, orange, yellow green blue and purple tags
source or it never happened

> [{quoted}](name=JuiceBoxP,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=JnaQRPEH,comment-id=00040001,timestamp=2019-08-27T22:20:59.568+0000)
>
> source or it never happened

Im pretty forum illiterate but its in a link in a post of a guy who posted about the issue. A rioter responded to it.

The problem is that basically gives everyone an excuse of "I was speaking Dutch," which I've already seen several times. What if my log is part Dutch and part English? What if I'm abusing the fact that that phrase is a well-known phrase in multi-lingual gaming, and I'm getting a free pass to use it?

This would only be on the EU servers that Riot chooses to support Dutch on, and would only apply when a Dutch fluent agent determines the user was attempting to have valid discussion in Dutch.

But yes, this is why I'm leery about this, but it is a solution that is better than "unban this one guy omg".

****
To elaborate, without Dutch support agents, how do players expect Riot to differentiate between these edge cases?

> [{quoted}](name=rujitra,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=JnaQRPEH,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2019-08-27T22:07:28.383+0000)But yes, this is why I'm leery about this, but it is a solution that is better than "unban this one guy omg".

Having an individual who speaks Dutch hired specifically to review logs containing that phrase *only* on servers where Dutch is officially allowed (regardless of other Dutch individuals in other regions) seems extremely impractical compared to handling on a one-guy basis the very rare number of cases where someone speaking Dutch actually means to say "kiss," a word that is extremely uncommon in *League* chat.

Then why not just unban the guy?
You have been proven that he did not do anything wrong.

> [{quoted}](name=JuiceBoxP,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=JnaQRPEH,comment-id=0002000000000000,timestamp=2019-08-27T22:19:12.524+0000)
>
> Then why not just unban the guy?
> You have been proven that he did not do anything wrong.

I'm a board moderator. I can't unban anyone save people banned on the NA boards. I don't work at Riot, and have no affiliation with any banning that is done anywhere but the NA boards.
Right, i forgot real rioters don't visit the boards anyhow.

Well, to handle it even on a "one-guy" basis requires that there be someone fluent in dutch to determine a few things:

* Is the player actually speaking Dutch
* Is the player speaking Dutch to the point that this likely was meaning "kiss" and not an attempt to game the system
* Is the use of the word in the sentence appropriate, or is the user actually using the word in lieu of another word to be "edgy"
* etc

Even if the cases are rare, the only way to reliably and accurately solve these cases is to have someone fluent in dutch reviewing them.

"i taught myself dutch so that i can tell people to "kys" in league of legends and escape punishment" is the hoops these people will jump through to pretend they're correct. no way to tell unless someone who actually speaks dutch reviews it! or a person with a brain...

> [{quoted}](name=DJColdCutz,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=JnaQRPEH,comment-id=00020000000000010000,timestamp=2019-08-27T22:54:43.394+0000)

> "i taught myself dutch so that i can tell people to "kys" in league of legends and escape punishment" is the hoops these people will jump through to pretend they're correct. no way to tell unless someone who actually speaks dutch reviews it! or a person with a brain...

kys in dutch is kiss

> [{quoted}](name=oBzAhKitty,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=JnaQRPEH,comment-id=000200000000000100000000,timestamp=2019-08-27T23:34:57.827+0000)
>
> kys in dutch is kiss

No, 'kys' doesn't exist in dutch.

All you people are talking about danish.

here's a crazy idea: why not read the whole chat and use context clues? were they speaking dutch before/after they said "kys"? were they flaming someone before/after they said "kys"? wowee! such hard! i'm not surprised rito, mods, and the support staff think this is difficult....
Merely "speaking dutch" does not mean that the usage of the word was appropriate in the context. It takes a fluent Dutch speaker to be able to determine if the use of the word was appropriate.
No it only takes 10 seconds to use google translate
Google Translate is not a valid method of translation for anything beyond personal use.

> [{quoted}](name=The Djinn,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=JnaQRPEH,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2019-08-27T22:05:05.594+0000)
>
> The problem is that basically gives everyone an excuse of "I was speaking Dutch," which I've already seen several times. What if my log is part Dutch and part English? What if I'm abusing the fact that that phrase is a well-known phrase in multi-lingual gaming, and I'm getting a free pass to use it?

Sure that is possible.
But there is also the risk of having false positives (as we have seen with the current debate) and I take the risk of false negatives (potential abuse) over that any day.

Man just stop.
The guy needs to be unbanned.
officially supported language or not,
he was not being abusive in chat.

He used a term that in all supported languages is a term that means "kill yourself".

The solution to that is for Riot to provide official support in Dutch. Otherwise you have a system that will cause more issues in the future.

Unbanning one person is not a solution to the "problem" of the word in dutch not being recognized. Furthermore, how do I just claim "i was speaking dutch" and if I throw some dutch words in my chat log, how would they know? A full Dutch support agent would be able to determine the difference between someone trying to game the system and someone legitimately speaking dutch.

Man, FUCK this supported langauge thing.
Who gives a fuck whether the language is supported or not?
Truth of the matter is the word "kys" exists in danish and he was infact speaking danish.

Was he abusive in chat?
did he flame his teammates?

if all of the above is "no"
then he should be unbanned.

>Unbanning one person is not a solution to the "problem"

Yes, it is.
That's what support tickets are for.
Machine can't think for themselves. 
that's why humans are involved.
you raise the problem to the human when machine makes mistakes.

Okay, so what do you propose? Sure, this case may be easy (**IF** you trust google translate, which in this case is accurate but in many cases is not), but many cases won't.

What happens if I say I speak Pashto and that "x word" means something different in Pashto? Do you know anyone who is fluent in Pashto? Are there support agents fluent in Pashto? The google translate for Pashto is known to be notoriously inaccurate and I have multiple fluent friends who will literally laugh at people who try to speak to them using google translated Pashto.

So where is the line drawn? Obviously you need someone who knows the language, or alternatively need to find resources other than Google Translate to back it up. This is why supported languages exist - Riot has dedicated fluent support staff for these languages.

That is why I am suggesting Riot hire a few Dutch support agents and support the language - this will no longer be an issue, and it appears evident that there is enough of a Dutch playerbase to merit it. Aside from that, you can't just say "they should do it because they should". Because then that argument can be used for anything. There are thousands of languages that are spoken throughout the world and in many of them "negro" (and even the n word itself) are words - you can't solve everything and Riot certainly shouldn't "just take their word for it" and unban it.

No one cares about other cases no one cares at all.

Were not talking about other cases.

Were talking about this one and only this one.

>Danish guy gets banned from league for saying "Kiss Kiss To You Beautiful <3"

Okay.

So please provide reasoning why this case is so **exceptional** that it merits an **exception** to the rules?

ARE YOU NOT READING ANYTHING OF WHAT I AM SAYING TO YOU?
Jesus christ.
you are infuriating.

#HE NEEDS TO BE UNBANNED BECAUSE HE DID NOT BREAK ANY RULE.
This exchange made my jaw drop. What the hell, rito....

I'm trusting the people in charge of the player base to use their big brain and strike balance and be reasonable.
Check multiple sources, maybe do a google search for the word.

If the word is legitimate, you cannot prove that he was using it with a malicious context.
Therefore, you cannot give a punishment, no matter how bad you want to, you just can't.
You know, unless the context is crystal clear that it is malicious.

What you're saying is people don't use their brain, follow the guidelines and basically work like soldiers.
no self thinking is involved. simple guidelines.
that is not how i would run a company.

A full Dutch support agent would be able to determine the difference between someone trying to game the system and someone legitimately speaking dutch.

or just don't ban people for writing "kys" problem solved.
If writing kys is such a bad thing why allow it to be sent as a message in the first place

> [{quoted}](name=oBzAhKitty,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=JnaQRPEH,comment-id=0001000000010000,timestamp=2019-08-27T22:39:05.281+0000)
>
> If writing kys is such a bad thing why allow it to be sent as a message in the first place

Well you can't stop people from freely writing whatever they want, so even if you do not allow it, people will likely rebel and say it more anyway. 
Things tend to work themselves out on their own. 

I will use drinking alcohol in the US for example. 

You have to be 21 to buy and drink alcohol in the US, but in other countries the minimum age requirement is usually 16-18 and penalties for it are minor whereas in the US kids drink before 21 and get way out of hand with it, and when they turn 21 they get totally wasted and abuse it, which can lead to disaster for some. 
When you ban something or restrict its use, the basic instinct for humans, is to rebel. 

So by banning the acronym you will only encourage its use, and strengthen its potency.

Ok then let's make murder legal so people don't do it to "rebel".

Your logic only applies to stupid kids. "OOO my daddy said I can't date this guy/girl, I am totally gonna bone them". 

Seriously, what other law against something has made it more desirable? The only reason this would apply would be if the rule/law was unfair/dumb in the first place.

And no if they banned the acronym so it always came up as *** with/without filter none would use it.
